original: gang gi sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyis dbang mtshan nyid pa bskur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyis dbang mtshan nyid pa bskur ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the tenth stage are empowered by the buddhas of the ten directions.

original: dang po bum pa'i dbang la gtsug bud ni bskur ba'i gnas spyi bo'o //
analyzed: dang po bum pa'i dbang la gtsug bud ni bskur ba'i gnas spyi bo'o //
translated: The first is the vase empowerment. The place where the empowerment is conferred is the crown.

original: gtsug pud  lcang lo can ni rtsa rnams 'dus pa'i gnas lcang lo can gyon pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug pud  lcang lo can ni rtsa rnams 'dus pa'i gnas lcang lo can gyon pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The crown is the place where the nāḍīs gather, like a braid.

original: mgo la ral pa'i cod pan can ni rtsa lnga rigs lnga'i bum pa dang 'dra ba la rtsa'i mu khyud kyi cod pan dang 'dra bar bcings pa'o //
analyzed: mgo la ral pa'i cod pan can ni rtsa lnga rigs lnga'i bum pa dang 'dra ba la rtsa'i mu khyud kyi cod pan dang 'dra bar bcings pa'o //
translated: The head has a crown of matted hair, which is like the vase of the five nāḍīs of the five families.

original: gdong lnga ni 'byung ba lnga'i rtsa 'dab lnga'o //
analyzed: gdong lnga ni 'byung ba lnga'i rtsa 'dab lnga'o //
translated: The five faces are the five petals of the nāḍīs of the five elements.

original: zur phud lnga dang ldan pa ni 'byung ba'i rlung rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: zur phud lnga dang ldan pa ni 'byung ba'i rlung rgyu ba'o //
translated: The five locks of hair are the movement of the vāyu of the five elements.

original: zur phud lnga'i rtse mo can ni rlung nyi khri chig stong drug brgya la sum stong drug brgya'i lhag ma 'gags nas de gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo nas rgyu'o //
analyzed: zur phud lnga'i rtse mo can ni rlung nyi khri chig stong drug brgya la sum stong drug brgya'i lhag ma 'gags nas de gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo nas rgyu'o //
translated: The five tips of the locks of hair are the vāyu that moves from the uṣṇīṣa cakra, with the remainder of the twenty-one thousand six hundred vāyus, which is three thousand six hundred.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bum pa'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bum pa'i dbang ngo //
translated: The consecration by all the Tathagatas is the vase empowerment.

original: mgo zlum brtul zhugs chen po pa //
analyzed: mgo zlum brtul zhugs chen po pa //
translated: The one with a shaven head, the one of great observances,

original: zhes pa mgo zlum ni sa bcu pa de dge slong yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mgo zlum ni sa bcu pa de dge slong yin pa'o //
translated: The one with a shaven head is the one on the tenth stage, the bhikshu.

original: brtul zhugs chen po pa ni gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes dbang ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs chen po pa ni gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes dbang ste /
translated: The one of great observances is the secret empowerment and the gnosis of the wisdom consort empowerment.

original: rtsa gzhan rlung rgyu ba brtul nas rtsa dbu mar zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa gzhan rlung rgyu ba brtul nas rtsa dbu mar zhugs pa'o //
translated: Having mastered the other channels through which the winds move, the winds enter the central channel.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni mi 'dzag pas so //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni mi 'dzag pas so //
translated: Pure conduct is because there is no emission.

original: des na brtul zhugs rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: des na brtul zhugs rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: Therefore, he is the supreme of those who observe observances.

original: des dka' thub mthar phyin pa dka' thub chen po'o //
analyzed: des dka' thub mthar phyin pa dka' thub chen po'o //
translated: He is the one who has perfected austerities, the one of great austerities.

original: gtsang gnas dam pa ni des nyon mongs pa rnams dag pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang gnas dam pa ni des nyon mongs pa rnams dag pa'o //
translated: The holy one of pure abodes is because he has purified the afflictions.

original: de su yin na goo ta ma ste bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'o //🔽bram ze tshangs pa ni gtsang sbra can la bya ste /
analyzed: de su yin na goo ta ma ste bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'o // bram ze tshangs pa ni gtsang sbra can la bya ste /
translated: Who is he? He is Gautama, the Bhagavat Shakyamuni.🔽Brahman, the pure one, is the one who is pure.

original: de bas kyang gtsang ba ni tshangs pa shes zhes pa nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang gtsang ba ni tshangs pa shes zhes pa nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dag pa'o //
translated: He is purer than the pure one, the one who is known as Brahma, because he has purified the stains of the afflictions.

original: mya ngan 'das pa tshangs pa thob pa ni tshangs pa bas ches lhag pa'i tshangs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa tshangs pa thob pa ni tshangs pa bas ches lhag pa'i tshangs pa thob pa'o //
translated: Attaining nirvana and Brahma is attaining a Brahma that is superior to Brahma.

original: 'gro ba ni 'khor ba las so //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'khor ba las so //
translated: Going is from samsara.

original: thar pa ni bcings pa las so //
analyzed: thar pa ni bcings pa las so //
translated: Liberation is from bondage.

original: rnam grol lus ni bde ba chen po'i sku'o //
analyzed: rnam grol lus ni bde ba chen po'i sku'o //
translated: The body of liberation is the great bliss body.

original: rnam par grol ba'i mchan nyid ni zhi ba bzhi pa ste chos sku'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i mchan nyid ni zhi ba bzhi pa ste chos sku'o //
translated: The nature of liberation is the fourth peace, the dharma body.

original: @219a * // de ltar dbang bstan nas 'bras bu la dang por mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @219a * // de ltar dbang bstan nas 'bras bu la dang por mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the empowerment, the result is first summarized:

original: mya ngan 'das shing ni nyan thos kyi phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das shing ni nyan thos kyi phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is the nonreturner of the sravakas.

original: mya ngan 'das pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: Great nirvana is the arhat.

original: legs par mya ngan 'das dang nye ba ni rang rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: legs par mya ngan 'das dang nye ba ni rang rgyal ba'o //
translated: Approaching nirvana is the pratyekabuddha.

original: bde sdug bsngal sel pa mthar gyur pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bde sdug bsngal sel pa mthar gyur pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The end of the removal of the suffering of happiness is the perfect buddha.

original: chags bral lus ni nyan thos so //
analyzed: chags bral lus ni nyan thos so //
translated: The body of freedom is the sravaka.

original: lus de las 'das pa ni sangs rgyas lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: lus de las 'das pa ni sangs rgyas lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body that transcends that is the simultaneously born body of the buddha.

original: da ni rgyas par bshad pa la chos sku rgyas pa la /
analyzed: da ni rgyas par bshad pa la chos sku rgyas pa la /
translated: Now, the extensive explanation of the dharmakāya.

original: thub pa med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thub pa med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Unconquerable means not under the power of others.

original: dpe med pa ni mtshan pa'i dpe med pa'o //
analyzed: dpe med pa ni mtshan pa'i dpe med pa'o //
translated: Unimaginable means without a metaphor.

original: mi mngon pa ni lha ru med pa'o //
analyzed: mi mngon pa ni lha ru med pa'o //
translated: Unmanifest means not existing as a god.

original: mi snang ba gzugs su grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi snang ba gzugs su grub pa med pa'o //
translated: Nonapparent means not established as form.

original: gsal byed min ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las gzhan gyis ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsal byed min ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las gzhan gyis ma byas pa'o //
translated: Not a creator means not created by anything other than natural luminosity.

original: mi 'gyur ni rkyen gyis so //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ni rkyen gyis so //
translated: Unchanging means not by conditions.

original: kun 'gro ni sems can nas sangs rgyas kyi bar ro //
analyzed: kun 'gro ni sems can nas sangs rgyas kyi bar ro //
translated: Pervasive means from sentient beings to buddhas.

original: khyab pa po ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: khyab pa po ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The pervader is the dharmadhātu.

original: phra ba ni rdul dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phra ba ni rdul dang bral ba'o //
translated: Subtle means free from particles.

original: zag pa med pa ni rgyus ma bskyed pas sa bon dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni rgyus ma bskyed pas sa bon dang bral ba'o //
translated: Uncontaminated means free from seeds because not produced by causes.

original: rdul med pa ni dang po nas so //
analyzed: rdul med pa ni dang po nas so //
translated: Particle-free means from the beginning.

original: rdul dang bral ba ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: rdul dang bral ba ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba yang med pa'o //
translated: Free from particles means free from the stains of adventitious defilements.

original: nyes pa spangs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa spangs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Abandoning faults means attachment and so on.

original: skyon med pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa yang spangs pa'o //🔽shin tu sad pa ni sa bcu gcig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: skyon med pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa yang spangs pa'o // shin tu sad pa ni sa bcu gcig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The faultless one is the one who has also abandoned the obscurations to omniscience.🔽The very awakened one is the gnosis of the eleventh ground.

original: sad pa'i bdag ni sa bcu gcig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sad pa'i bdag ni sa bcu gcig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The self-awakened one is the gnosis of the eleventh ground.

original: kun shes ni ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: kun shes ni ji lta ba'o //
translated: The all-knowing one is the way things are.

original: kun rig dam pa po ni ji snyed pa shes pa'i ye shes yin pas dam pa'o //
analyzed: kun rig dam pa po ni ji snyed pa shes pa'i ye shes yin pas dam pa'o //
translated: The holy all-knowing one is the gnosis of the way things are in their diversity, and thus is holy.

original: 'o na rang rig don dam par 'dod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang rig don dam par 'dod dam zhe na /
translated: Well then, is self-awareness asserted to be ultimate?

original: rnam par shes pa'i chod nyid 'das //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chod nyid 'das //
translated: It is beyond the domain of consciousness.

original: zhes pa rang rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa rang rig pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not self-awareness.

original: rang rig pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is beyond the dharmatā of self-awareness.

original: ye shes gnyis med tshul 'chang ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis med tshul 'chang ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who holds the mode of nondual gnosis is the connate gnosis that is unchangingly supreme.

original: rnam par rtog med ni ye shes de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med ni ye shes de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Nonconceptuality is the defining characteristic of that gnosis.

original: lhun gyis grub pa ni ye shes de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa ni ye shes de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Spontaneously present is the nature of that gnosis.

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pa ni ye shes de'i las yin te 'das ma 'ongs da ltar ba mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pa ni ye shes de'i las yin te 'das ma 'ongs da ltar ba mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The one who acts for the buddhas of the three times is the function of that gnosis, which is the knowledge of the past, future, and present.

original: de ltar chos sku rgyas par bshad nas //
analyzed: de ltar chos sku rgyas par bshad nas //
translated: Having thus explained the dharmakāya in detail,

original: de la ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: the characteristics of the jñānakāya are as follows.

original: sangs rgyas thog ma med pa ni thog ma med pa nas rang byung ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thog ma med pa ni thog ma med pa nas rang byung ba'o //
translated: “Buddhahood without beginning” means that it is self-originated from🔽beginningless time.

original: tha ma med pa ni mi 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma med pa ni mi 'gag pa'o //
translated: “Without end” means that it is unceasing.

original: des na dang po rang nas sangs @219b rgyas pa'o //🔽rgyu med pa ni thabs las byung ba yang min /
analyzed: des na dang po rang nas sangs @219b rgyas pa'o // rgyu med pa ni thabs las byung ba yang min /
translated: Therefore, “from the beginning, buddhahood” means that it is buddha🔽from the beginning.

original: shes rab las byung ba yang min pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab las byung ba yang min pa'o //
translated: “Without cause” means that it does not arise from method or wisdom.🔽“The single eye of wisdom” means that the jñānakāya is seen through

original: ye shes mig gcig ni bsgrub pa'i dus kyi lta stangs kyis ye shes kyi sku mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes mig gcig ni bsgrub pa'i dus kyi lta stangs kyis ye shes kyi sku mthong ba'o //
translated: the gaze at the time of practice.🔽“Stainless” means that the eye of wisdom, the result of practice, is

original: dri ma med pa ni bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu ye shes kyi spyan dngos po thob pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu ye shes kyi spyan dngos po thob pa'o //
translated: actually attained.🔽“The tathāgata with a jñānakāya” means that the jñānakāya is seen

original: ye shes lus can de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes kyi sku nam mkha' na bzhugs pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes lus can de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes kyi sku nam mkha' na bzhugs pa mthong ba'o //
translated: residing in space.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sprul pa'i sku ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ltar du snang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sprul pa'i sku ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ltar du snang ba'o //
translated: “The tathāgata” is the nirmāṇakāya, which appears like the saṃbhogakāya.

original: gzugs brnyan de las chos kyi sgra 'byung ba lha'i rna bas thos te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de las chos kyi sgra 'byung ba lha'i rna bas thos te /
translated: The sound of the Dharma comes from that reflection, and is heard by the divine ear.

original: tshig gi dbang phyug ces pas chos thams cad la dbang sgyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi dbang phyug ces pas chos thams cad la dbang sgyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is called Lord of Speech is the one who has power over all phenomena.

original: sgra che ba ni zab pa'i chos so //
analyzed: sgra che ba ni zab pa'i chos so //
translated: The great sound is the profound Dharma.

original: smra ba'i skyes mchog smra ba'i rgyal ni 'gran zla med pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i skyes mchog smra ba'i rgyal ni 'gran zla med pa'o //
translated: The supreme speaker, king of speakers is the one who is without rival.

original: smra ba'i dam pa ni chos so //
analyzed: smra ba'i dam pa ni chos so //
translated: The best of speakers is the Dharma.

original: mchog gi gnas ni gsang sngags so //
analyzed: mchog gi gnas ni gsang sngags so //
translated: The supreme abode is the secret mantra.

original: smra ba'i seng ge ni sangs rgyas kho na'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i seng ge ni sangs rgyas kho na'o //
translated: The lion of speakers is the Buddha himself.

original: tshugs pa med pa ni bdud dang mu stegs nyan thos rang rgyal rnams kyis so //
analyzed: tshugs pa med pa ni bdud dang mu stegs nyan thos rang rgyal rnams kyis so //
translated: The unassailable one is the one who cannot be assailed by demons, non-Buddhists, śrāvakas, or pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ltar gsung la bstod nas /
analyzed: de ltar gsung la bstod nas /
translated: Having thus praised his speech,

original: sprul pa'i sku mdzad pa la bstod pa ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku mdzad pa la bstod pa ni /
translated: he praises the activities of the emanation body:

original: kun du lta ba ni shes rab kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la lta ba dang snying rjes 'khor ba lta'o //
analyzed: kun du lta ba ni shes rab kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la lta ba dang snying rjes 'khor ba lta'o //
translated: The all-seeing one is the one who sees nirvāṇa with wisdom and samsāra with compassion.

original: mchog tu dga' ni de nyid la ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ni de nyid la ma chags pa'o //
translated: The supremely joyful one is the one who is not attached to those [two].

original: gzi brjid phreng ba ni sku la rgyan sna tshogs mnga' bas lta na sdug pa'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid phreng ba ni sku la rgyan sna tshogs mnga' bas lta na sdug pa'o //
translated: The garland of splendor is the one who is beautiful to behold due to possessing various ornaments on his body.

original: 'od bzang 'bar ba ni sku la 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs pa 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: 'od bzang 'bar ba ni sku la 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs pa 'phro ba'o //
translated: The blazing of good light is the emission of various colored light rays from the body.

original: dpal gyi be'u ni thugs ka na'o //
analyzed: dpal gyi be'u ni thugs ka na'o //
translated: The sign of good fortune is at the heart.

original: de yang ye shes sems dpa' thugs ka na bzhugs pa'i phyag na bsnams pa lag na 'od 'bar snang ba po zhes so //
analyzed: de yang ye shes sems dpa' thugs ka na bzhugs pa'i phyag na bsnams pa lag na 'od 'bar snang ba po zhes so //
translated: Moreover, it is held in the hand of the gnosis being who resides at the heart, and is called the one who shines with light in the hand.

original: sman ba che mchog ni sems can nyon mongs pa'i nad gso bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sman ba che mchog ni sems can nyon mongs pa'i nad gso bar byed pa'o //
translated: The great physician is the one who heals the disease of sentient beings' afflictions.

original: gtso bo ni mchog tu gyur pa ste //
analyzed: gtso bo ni mchog tu gyur pa ste //
translated: The chief is the supreme one.

original: zug rngu 'byin pa ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: zug rngu 'byin pa ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi'o //
translated: The remover of pain is the one of the three sufferings.

original: bla na med pa ni gang na med pa'i yang gong mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni gang na med pa'i yang gong mar gyur pa'o //
translated: The unsurpassed is the one who is above the one who is above.

original: sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing //
analyzed: sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing //
translated: The tree of all medicines

original: zhes pa lo ka las sman gyi ljon shing las nad gso ba'i sman skye ba bzhin 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gso ba'i mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lo ka las sman gyi ljon shing las nad gso ba'i sman skye ba bzhin 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gso ba'i mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes ston pa'o //
translated: is the tree of medicine in the world, from which medicines for healing illnesses grow. It shows the unchanging gnosis that heals the sufferings of samsara.

original: des nad dang nyon mongs pa gso bas na /
analyzed: des nad dang nyon mongs pa gso bas na /
translated: Since it heals illnesses and afflictions,

original: nad do cog gi dgra che ba'o /
analyzed: nad do cog gi dgra che ba'o /
translated: it is the great enemy of all illnesses.

original: sdu gu ni nyon mongs pa gso ba'o //
analyzed: sdu gu ni nyon mongs pa gso ba'o //
translated: The charming is the healing of the afflictions.

original: 'jig rten gsum ni khams gsum ste de na gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum ni khams gsum ste de na gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The three worlds are the three realms, and he is the supreme one among those who dwell there.

original: de ltar sprul pa'i sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa bshad nas /🔽dpal @220a * //
analyzed: de ltar sprul pa'i sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa bshad nas / dpal @220a * //
translated: Having explained the emanation body with its deeds,🔽now, the second verse is stated:

original: ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can //
analyzed: ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can //
translated: The glorious one with the mandala of the constellations,

original: zhes pa la sprul pa'i sku de yang gzhan don du snang lugs gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sprul pa'i sku de yang gzhan don du snang lugs gsum ste /
translated: This emanation body also has three ways of appearing for the benefit of others:

original: phyi dang nang dang gzhan du'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang dang gzhan du'o //
translated: externally, internally, and in other ways.

original: phyi 'jig rten gyi khams ltar snang ste /
analyzed: phyi 'jig rten gyi khams ltar snang ste /
translated: Externally, it appears like the world systems.

original: dpal ldan ni ri rab gling bzhi'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan ni ri rab gling bzhi'o //
translated: The glorious one is Mount Meru and the four continents.

original: rgyu skar ni nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: rgyu skar ni nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The constellations are the twenty-seven.

original: dkyil 'khor ni khyim bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni khyim bcu gnyis so //
translated: The mandala is the twelve houses.

original: can ni nyi ma dang zla ba gza' rnams so //
analyzed: can ni nyi ma dang zla ba gza' rnams so //
translated: The one is the sun, moon, and planets.

original: phyogs bcu nam mkha'i mthar thug pa ni khyim der 'khor bar ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu nam mkha'i mthar thug pa ni khyim der 'khor bar ro //
translated: The ten directions are the limits of space, revolving in those houses.

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'jugs  ni sems can la nyin nub dang nam zla dang grang dro dang ston dpyid kyi sgo nas don byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'jugs  ni sems can la nyin nub dang nam zla dang grang dro dang ston dpyid kyi sgo nas don byed pa'o //
translated: The Dharma banner is well raised means that he acts for the sake of sentient beings day and night, in the seasons, in cold and heat, in autumn and spring.

original: 'gro na ni phyogs rnams su 'khor ba'o //

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas padmar skyes ni stong pa bdag med pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas padmar skyes ni stong pa bdag med pa las byung ba'o //
translated: is the one who arises from emptiness, the absence of self.

original: kun mkhyen ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The omniscient one is the one who knows everything.

analyzed: ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who holds the treasure of pristine consciousness is the one endowed with the five pristine consciousnesses, such as the mirror-like pristine consciousness, and so on.

analyzed: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chad ni gang la gang gis 'dul bar snang ba'o //
translated: The king who explains the various magical manifestations is the one who appears to tame whomever by any means necessary.

original: sangs rgyas rig pa chen po 'dzin pa ni ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rig pa chen po 'dzin pa ni ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The buddha who holds the great knowledge is the one who knows everything there is to know.

original: rdo rje rnon po ral gri che ni des spang bya'i spros pa bcad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon po ral gri che ni des spang bya'i spros pa bcad pa'o //
translated: The great sword of the vajra is sharp, in that it cuts off the proliferation of what is to be abandoned.

original: yi ge mchog ste rnam par dag / ces pa mchog mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge mchog ste rnam par dag / ces pa mchog mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa'o //
translated: The supreme syllable, which is completely pure, refers to the accomplishment of unchanging gnosis.

original: dri ma dag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma dag par byas pa'o //
translated: It is completely purified of stains.

original: theg pa mchog ni gsang sngags te mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: theg pa mchog ni gsang sngags te mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The supreme vehicle is the mantra, which is unchanging gnosis.

original: des na sdug bsngal gcod pa'o //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal gcod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it cuts off suffering.

original: mtshon cha chen po ni sdug bsngal gcod pa'i rdo rje chos te dbyer mi phyed pa'i ye shes la rdo rje chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha chen po ni sdug bsngal gcod pa'i rdo rje chos te dbyer mi phyed pa'i ye shes la rdo rje chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The great weapon is the vajra of cutting off suffering, and the gnosis of indivisibility is called the vajra of phenomena.

original: rdo rje zab mo ni stong ba nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje zab mo ni stong ba nyid do //
translated: The profound vajra is emptiness.

original: dzi na dzi ka ni rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba gcod pa'o //
analyzed: dzi na dzi ka ni rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba gcod pa'o //
translated: Jinajik is the cutting off of the appearance of variety.

original: rdo rje blo gros ni mi 'gyur pa'i shes rab /
analyzed: rdo rje blo gros ni mi 'gyur pa'i shes rab /
translated: Vajra wisdom is unchanging wisdom.

original: don bzhin rig ni des ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa rig pa'o //
analyzed: don bzhin rig ni des ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa rig pa'o //
translated: Knowing reality is knowing things as they are and in their multiplicity.

original: pha rol phyin pa kun rdzogs pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa gong du rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa kun rdzogs pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa gong du rgyas par bshad do //
translated: The perfection of all perfections is endowed with generosity and so forth, as explained above in detail.

original: sa rnams kun gyi rgyan dang ldan //
analyzed: sa rnams kun gyi rgyan dang ldan //
translated: It is adorned with all the stages.

original: yang de bzhin du gang du bshad do //
analyzed: yang de bzhin du gang du bshad do //
translated: And it is explained in the same way.

original: rnam par dag pa dri ma yongs su dag go //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dri ma yongs su dag go //
translated: Purity is the complete purification of stains.

original: bdag med chos ni rang bzhin rnam dag gi chos nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med chos ni rang bzhin rnam dag gi chos nyid do //
translated: The selfless dharma is the nature of phenomena, which is naturally pure.

original: yang dag ye shes ni sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes ni sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Correct wisdom is the mind, which is naturally luminous.

original: zla 'od ni @222a * //
analyzed: zla 'od ni @222a * //
translated: Candraprabha🔽is the example.

original: dpe'o // bzang ba ni de bas ches lhag pa'i 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dpe'o // bzang ba ni de bas ches lhag pa'i 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Excellent is the luminosity that is even greater than that.

original: brtson chen ni sgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: brtson chen ni sgrub pa la'o //
translated: Great diligence is in practice.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba ni snang ba dang stong pa dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba ni snang ba dang stong pa dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
translated: The magical net is the inseparability of appearance and emptiness.

original: rgyud kun ni bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud kun ni bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor bla na med pa'o //
translated: All the tantras are the action, conduct, yoga, and unsurpassed yoga tantras.

original: de dang bdag po 'am mchog ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bdag po 'am mchog ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: The lord or supreme of those is the Litany of the Names of Manjushri.

original: bdag gi gdan la sogs pa'i gdan bzhi yang 'di la tshang bas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi gdan la sogs pa'i gdan bzhi yang 'di la tshang bas ldan pa'o //
translated: Since the four seats of one's own and so on are complete in it, it is endowed.

original: ye shes sku rnams ma lus 'chang ba ni ye shes sems dpa' drug gi ngo bo ye shes mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes la 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sku rnams ma lus 'chang ba ni ye shes sems dpa' drug gi ngo bo ye shes mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes la 'dus pa'o //
translated: The one who holds all the wisdom bodies without exception is the essence of the six sattvas of timeless awareness, subsumed in the unchanging timeless awareness.

original: kun du bzang po ni dug lnga'i snang ba ye shes lnga shar bas blo gros bzang po'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po ni dug lnga'i snang ba ye shes lnga shar bas blo gros bzang po'o //
translated: “ Samantabhadra” is the “good mind” because the appearances of the five poisons arise as the five timeless awarenesses.

original: sa'i snying po ni khams lnga'i dang sa ma byang chub sems so //
analyzed: sa'i snying po ni khams lnga'i dang sa ma byang chub sems so //
translated: “ Kṣitigarbha” is the bodhicitta that is the unrefined element of the five elements.

analyzed: 'gro ba 'dzin pa ni des lus la gnas kyi bar du srog mi 'pho ba'o // sangs rgyas kun gyi snying po che ni kun rdzob byang chub sems la brten nas /
translated: “ Jagad-dhara” is the life force that does not depart as long as the body remains.

original: don dam byang chub sems gnas pas na snying po'o //
analyzed: don dam byang chub sems gnas pas na snying po'o //
translated: “ The great essence of all buddhas” is the essence because the ultimate bodhicitta is based on the relative bodhicitta.

original: de ltar lam gyi rnal 'byor bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lam gyi rnal 'byor bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the path yoga,

original: da ni 'bras bu mjug bsdu ba las /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu mjug bsdu ba las /
translated: now, in the conclusion of the result,

original: dang po sprul ba'i sku ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo sna tshogs 'chang ba ni thabs sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang po sprul ba'i sku ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo sna tshogs 'chang ba ni thabs sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
translated: first, the nirmāṇakāya is “the one who holds the various emanated wheels” because the benefit of beings is performed through various methods.

analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog ste snang stong gnyis med kyi sku'o //
translated: The enjoyment body is the supreme nature of all things, the body of nondual appearance and emptiness.

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin ni snang tsam na stong la stong tsam na snang ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin ni snang tsam na stong la stong tsam na snang ba'o //
translated: It holds the nature of all things, in that it is empty when there is mere appearance, and it is appearance when there is mere emptiness.

original: skye med chos ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: skye med chos ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Unborn phenomena are the ultimate.

original: sna tshogs don ni snang ba ma 'gags par shar ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs don ni snang ba ma 'gags par shar ba'o //
translated: The various objects are appearances that arise without being blocked.

original: chos kun ni 'khor 'das kyi'o //
analyzed: chos kun ni 'khor 'das kyi'o //
translated: All phenomena are those of samsara and nirvana.

original: ngo bo nyid 'chang ba ni longs sku'i do bor bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'chang ba ni longs sku'i do bor bzhugs pa'o //
translated: It holds the essence, in that it abides as the essence of the enjoyment body.

original: da ni chos kyi sku la /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi sku la /
translated: Now, in the dharmakāya,

original: shes rab chen pos skad cig la //
analyzed: shes rab chen pos skad cig la //
translated: it says, “In an instant with great wisdom…”

original: zhes pa thos bsam sgom gsum gyi shes rab po //
analyzed: zhes pa thos bsam sgom gsum gyi shes rab po //
translated: The wisdom of hearing, contemplating, and meditating.

original: chos kun khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: chos kun khong du chud pa ste /
translated: It says, “It comprehends all phenomena…”

original: zhes pa shes bya ma lus pa thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa shes bya ma lus pa thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: It comprehends all objects of knowledge without exception.

original: chos kun mngon par rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: chos kun mngon par rtogs pa ste //
translated: It says, “It realizes all phenomena…”

original: zhes pa de yang mngon sum kho nar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de yang mngon sum kho nar rtogs pa'o //
translated: It realizes that directly.

original: thub pa ni sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: thub pa ni sku gsung thugs so //
translated: “Sage” refers to body, speech, and mind.

original: des na blo mchog go //
analyzed: des na blo mchog go //
translated: Therefore, it is the supreme mind.

original: 'byung ba'i mtha' ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i mtha' sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtha' ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i mtha' sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: The end of the elements is the end of definite emergence from cyclic existence, which is buddhahood.

analyzed: de ye shes kyi sku ni mi g-yo ba lhan cig skyes pa'i sku de'o //
translated: That is the non-moving, co-emergent body of gnosis.

analyzed: rab tu dang ba'i bdag ni glo bur gyi dri ma dag pa'o //
translated: The pure self is the purity of the adventitious stains.

analyzed: des na rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de bla na med pa'i byang chub 'chang ba'o //
translated: Therefore, that perfect buddha holds unsurpassed enlightenment.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi mngon sum pa @222b ni mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes de'o //
translated: The manifest presence of all buddhas is that unchanging gnosis.

original: ye shes me lce ni 'khor ba'i rnam rtog sreg pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes me lce ni 'khor ba'i rnam rtog sreg pa'o //
translated: The flame of gnosis burns the concepts of cyclic existence.

original: 'od 'bar gsal ba ni ye shes kyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'od 'bar gsal ba ni ye shes kyi snang ba'o //
translated: The blazing light is the appearance of gnosis.

original: de ltar le'u brgyad pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar le'u brgyad pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: Thus concludes the explanation of the eighth chapter.

original: // / da ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, praise is expressed from the perspective of the gnosis of equality.

original: dang po dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor la /
analyzed: dang po dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor la /
translated: First, in the yoga of shape,

analyzed: rkyang bar bsgom na srung ba'i 'khor lo dbang bskur yan chad rdzogs par bya'o //

analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas yab yum byang dang dbang ldan la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Amitābha and his consort reside in the north and in the northeast.

translated: At Ratnasaṃbhava’s heart, on a sun maṇḍala, is the gnosis being, Jñānakāmadeva, red in color, holding a sword in his right hand and a jewel in his left hand.

original: de'i thugs ka nas 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa la /
analyzed: de'i thugs ka nas 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa la /
translated: From his heart, on an eight-petaled lotus,

analyzed: aom w'a g'i shva ra ya te na ma: zhes pa'o //
translated: is oṃ vāgīśvara ya te namaḥ.

analyzed: de'i lte ba la aa dmar po gnas par bsum mo //
translated: In its center is a red a.

analyzed: lho phyogs pa'i lha gzhan rnams kyang mi bskyod pa bzhin phyag mtshan dang sku mdog gyur par bsam mo //

translated: The benefit of sentient beings is taught in brief and in detail through his body, the path with its result, the general teaching on emancipation, and the teaching on the characteristics of the body of pristine awareness, which is the antidote to what is to be eliminated.

original: de grub pas na don grub pa'o //
analyzed: de grub pas na don grub pa'o //
translated: Since that is accomplished, the goal is accomplished.

original: dam pa ni gong na med pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa ni gong na med pa'o //
translated: Supreme means unsurpassed.

original: dan song thams cad ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang byol song ngo /
analyzed: dan song thams cad ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang byol song ngo /
translated: All miserable states are the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: sbyong ba ni las de las thar bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyong ba ni las de las thar bar byed pa'o //
translated: Purification is the liberation from those actions.

original: mgon po ni ngan song gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni ngan song gsum gyi'o //
translated: The protector is from the three miserable states.

original: des na sems can kun gyi mchog go //
analyzed: des na sems can kun gyi mchog go //
translated: Therefore, he is the best of all sentient beings.

analyzed: sems can thams cad rab grol byed pa ni dbang po rab 'bring la theg pa so sor don byed pa'o //
translated: The one who completely liberates all sentient beings is the one who benefits each of those of highest, medium, and lowest abilities according to their respective vehicles.

original: nyon mongs g-yul du gcig dpa' ba //
analyzed: nyon mongs g-yul du gcig dpa' ba //
translated: He is the one hero in the battle with the afflictions.

analyzed: zhes ba 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa las 'thab pa la gcig tu dpa' ba'o //
translated: He is the one hero in the battle with the afflictions of cyclic existence.

original: mi shes pa ni gti mug / dgra ni zhe sdang / dregs pa ni nga rgyal /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni gti mug / dgra ni zhe sdang / dregs pa ni nga rgyal /
translated: Ignorance is delusion, enemies are hatred, and pride is arrogance.

original: 'joms pas na dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: 'joms pas na dpa' ba'o //
translated: He is a hero because he conquers them.

analyzed: de nas rgyas pa la sprul skus gzhan don mdzad pa la bstod pa ni /
translated: Next, the praise of the emanation body's deeds for the benefit of others in the extensive [system] is as follows.

original: blo ldan ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: blo ldan ni shes rab bo //
translated: The wise one is wisdom.

original: sgeg 'chang ni rgyan dang cha @223a * //
analyzed: sgeg 'chang ni rgyan dang cha @223a * //
translated: The one who displays beauty is the one who has ornaments and attire.

analyzed: lugs so // dpal dang ldan pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes las grub pa'o //
translated: The glorious one is the one who is accomplished from merit and wisdom.

analyzed: brtan po mi sdug gzugs 'chang ba ni khro bos 'dul ba'i dor khro bor snang ngo //

analyzed: gom pa'i stabs kyis gar byed pa ni g-yas brkyang ba la sogs pa'i gom stabs so //

original: dpal ldan lag pa brgyas gang ba //
analyzed: dpal ldan lag pa brgyas gang ba //
translated: The one who is glorious and filled with a hundred hands

original: nam mkha' khyab par gar byed pa //

translated: The miracle of pressing down with the sole of one foot is the power of miracle.

analyzed: de bas na zhes nga rgyal ba la //
translated: Therefore, in pride,

analyzed: zhes pa tshangs pa'i yul sa ni gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas ba'o //
