translated: Now, the praise of the benefit done by the emanation body.

original: da ni chos skus gzhan don byed pa ni /
analyzed: da ni chos skus gzhan don byed pa ni /
translated: Now, the benefit done by the Dharma body is

original: don gcig ni thob bya chos sku'o //
analyzed: don gcig ni thob bya chos sku'o //
translated: the one meaning is the Dharma body to be attained.

original: gnyis med ni kun rdzob dang don dam gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis med ni kun rdzob dang don dam gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Non-dual is the non-duality of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: da ni chos kyi don to //
analyzed: da ni chos kyi don to //
translated: Now, the meaning of the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i don de ni chos sku'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i don de ni chos sku'o //
translated: The ultimate meaning is the Dharma body.

original: 'jigs pa med pa ni gnod pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa ni gnod pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: Fearless means not being harmed by others.

original: rnam rig sna tshogs gzugs don can ni don bya ba'i yul sems can no //
analyzed: rnam rig sna tshogs gzugs don can ni don bya ba'i yul sems can no //
translated: Various consciousnesses means sentient beings, the objects of the activity of benefit.

original: sems ni kun gzhi /
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi /
translated: Mind means the all-base.🔽Consciousness means the six collections.

original: rnam shes ni tshogs drug / rgyud dang ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa can ni yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes ni tshogs drug / rgyud dang ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa can ni yid do //
translated: The afflicted mind is the continuum.

original: dngos don ma lus rnams la dga' ni sems can don la sangs rgyas dngos la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dngos don ma lus rnams la dga' ni sems can don la sangs rgyas dngos la dga' ba'o //
translated: Delight in all things means delight in sentient beings, the object of benefit, and delight in the Buddha, the actual object.

original: stong pa nyid dga' ba ni shes rab chen pos stong pa nyid la chags pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dga' ba ni shes rab chen pos stong pa nyid la chags pa'o //
translated: Delight in emptiness means attachment to emptiness through great wisdom.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa ste //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa ste //
translated: Abandoning desire for existence

original: zhes pa 'dod pa'i yon tan spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dod pa'i yon tan spangs pa'o //
translated: means abandoning the qualities of desire.

original: dang po skus sems can don mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: dang po skus sems can don mdzad pa ni /
translated: First, the benefit for sentient beings through the kāyas:

original: srid gsum dga' ba chen po pa //
analyzed: srid gsum dga' ba chen po pa //
translated: The great delight of the three existences

original: zhes pa 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'o //
translated: means the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //
analyzed: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //
translated: White like a pure white cloud

original: zhes pa longs sku de nam mkha' dag pa la sprin dkar po yang med par dag pa bzhin du chos nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa longs sku de nam mkha' dag pa la sprin dkar po yang med par dag pa bzhin du chos nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
translated: This is the sambhogakaya, which is like the pure sky, free of even the white clouds of the natural purity of dharmata.

original: 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od //
analyzed: 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od //
translated: The light of the autumn moon

original: ces pa ni sku'i mdangs so //
analyzed: ces pa ni sku'i mdangs so //
translated: is the radiance of the body.

original: nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil ltar mdzes //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil ltar mdzes //
translated: Beautiful like the rising sun

original: zhes pa 'od zer gyi tshogs dpag tu med @223b pa mnga' bas so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'od zer gyi tshogs dpag tu med @223b pa mnga' bas so //
translated: is the radiance of the body, which possesses an immeasurable collection of light rays.

original: sen mo'i 'od ni shes cher dmar //
analyzed: sen mo'i 'od ni shes cher dmar //
translated: The light of the nails is very red

original: zhes pa phyag dang zhabs kyi sen mo'o //
analyzed: zhes pa phyag dang zhabs kyi sen mo'o //
translated: is the nails of the hands and feet.

original: cod pan bzang po mthon ka'i rtse //
analyzed: cod pan bzang po mthon ka'i rtse //
translated: The excellent crown is the peak of Meru

original: zhes pa dbu'i cod pan bltar mi mngon pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dbu'i cod pan bltar mi mngon pa'o //
translated: is the crown of the head, which is invisible.

original: bltar mi mngon pas sgra mchog mthon ka chen po pa'o //
analyzed: bltar mi mngon pas sgra mchog mthon ka chen po pa'o //
translated: Since it is invisible, it is the supreme sound, the great Meru.

original: nor bu chen po 'od chags dpal ni /
analyzed: nor bu chen po 'od chags dpal ni /
translated: The great jewel is the radiant glory

original: cod pan gyi rtse mo la nor bu rin po che'o ;
analyzed: cod pan gyi rtse mo la nor bu rin po che'o ;
translated: is the crown jewel at the peak of the head.

original: / sangs rgyas ni longs sku'o //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas ni longs sku'o //
translated: The buddha is the sambhogakaya.

original: sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad 'od dang gzim dangs so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad 'od dang gzim dangs so //
translated: The ornaments of the nirmanakaya are the major and minor marks, light, and radiance.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa ni gdul bya'i snang ba la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa ni gdul bya'i snang ba la'o //
translated: “Shaking a hundred world systems” is from the perspective of the appearances of those to be tamed.

original: 'jig rten khams rnams su dus gcig la khyab po snyam na /
analyzed: 'jig rten khams rnams su dus gcig la khyab po snyam na /
translated: If it is wondered, “Are they pervaded simultaneously in all world systems?”

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan //
translated: “The power of the great base of miracles”

original: zhes pa rdzu 'phrul gyis gshegs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rdzu 'phrul gyis gshegs par snang ba'o //
translated: appears as the mode of going by means of miracles.

original: lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni /
translated: The path with its result is

original: de nyid ma bcos pa'i don lhan cig skyes par mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ma bcos pa'i don lhan cig skyes par mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: the meaning of unfabricated suchness that does not change.

original: dran pa ni mi brjed pa yin la /
analyzed: dran pa ni mi brjed pa yin la /
translated: “Recollection” is nonforgetfulness.

original: dran pa chen po ni mi 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa chen po ni mi 'bral ba'o //
translated: “Great recollection” is nonseparation.

original: dran pa bzhi po ni mi 'bral ba'i don de yang rgyu'i dus su rkyen gyi dbang gis gnas skabs bzhir snang ste /
analyzed: dran pa bzhi po ni mi 'bral ba'i don de yang rgyu'i dus su rkyen gyi dbang gis gnas skabs bzhir snang ste /
translated: The meaning of nonseparation of those four recollections is that at the time of the cause, the four states appear through the power of conditions.

original: gnyid dang / rmi lam ngang /
analyzed: gnyid dang / rmi lam ngang /
translated: Sleep, dreams,

original: sad pa dang / bzhi pa'o //🔽ting nge 'dzin rgyal ni gnyid chos skur dran pa'o //🔽rmi lam longs skur dran pa /
analyzed: sad pa dang / bzhi pa'o // ting nge 'dzin rgyal ni gnyid chos skur dran pa'o // rmi lam longs skur dran pa /
translated: and waking are the four.🔽“Samādhi” is the recollection of sleep as the dharmakāya.

original: sad pa sprul skur dran pa /
analyzed: sad pa sprul skur dran pa /
translated: “King” is the recollection of dreams as the sambhogakāya.🔽“Victorious” is the recollection of waking as the nirmāṇakāya.

original: bzhi pa ye shes kyi skur dran pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ye shes kyi skur dran pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'o //
translated: The fourth, the mindfulness of the jñānakāya, is the King of Samādhis.

original: de ltar rkyen gyis g-yo ba'i rgyur ni yod de /
analyzed: de ltar rkyen gyis g-yo ba'i rgyur ni yod de /
translated: As such, the cause of movement by conditions exists.

original: byang chub ni sems nyid mi g-yo ba rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni sems nyid mi g-yo ba rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: Awakening is the immobility of the mind, abiding in its natural condition.

original: yan lag ces pa rlung ste sems yul la g-yo bar byed pas rmi lam dang sad pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yan lag ces pa rlung ste sems yul la g-yo bar byed pas rmi lam dang sad pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The “limbs” are the vāyus, which cause the mind to move to objects, the cause of dreams and waking.

original: me tog ni khrag / spos ni khu ba de bzhi tshogs pas bzhi pa skye ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: me tog ni khrag / spos ni khu ba de bzhi tshogs pas bzhi pa skye ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The “flower” is blood, and the “incense” is semen. The cause of the arising of the fourth is the union of those four.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho //
translated: The “ocean” is the quality of the tathāgatas.

original: zhes pa bzhi pa ye shes mi 'dzag par song ba'am /
analyzed: zhes pa bzhi pa ye shes mi 'dzag par song ba'am /
translated: The fourth is the “ocean” of the gnosis that has become the state of nonemission.

original: mi 'gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni ste rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra bar zad mi shes pa'o //🔽de thob par byed pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni ste rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra bar zad mi shes pa'o // de thob par byed pa ni /
translated: The “resultant unchanging” is like a great ocean, inexhaustible.

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig / ces pa dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor la /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig / ces pa dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor la /
translated: The “means of attaining” that is, the “eight branches of the path” is the yoga of shape.

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo la brten pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' dpa' bo gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo la brten pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' dpa' bo gcig pa'o //
translated: There is the maṇḍala wheel and the gnosis hero, the sole hero.

original: sngags kyi rnal 'byor la srog rtsol dang bum pa can no //
analyzed: sngags kyi rnal 'byor la srog rtsol dang bum pa can no //
translated: The yoga of mantra is the life-force control and the vase-breathing.

original: chos kyi rnal 'byor la gzhan lus la brten pa dang rang lus so //
analyzed: chos kyi rnal 'byor la gzhan lus la brten pa dang rang lus so //
translated: The yoga of reality is the one based on another's body and the one based on one's own body.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor la mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor dang nyin mo'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor la mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor dang nyin mo'i'o //
translated: The yoga of suchness is the yoga of the night and the yoga of the day.

original: yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa //
translated: The path of the perfect Buddha is known.

original: zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes ni yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam mo //🔽sems can @224a * //
analyzed: zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes ni yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam mo // sems can @224a * //
translated: The unchanging pristine awareness is the path of the perfect Buddha.

original: kun la shas cher chags //
analyzed: kun la shas cher chags //
translated: One is greatly attached to all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'o //
translated: This is non-referential compassion.

original: nam mkha' lta bur chags pa med //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur chags pa med //
translated: One is unattached like space.

original: ces pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong ba nyid de gnyis dbyer med pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong ba nyid de gnyis dbyer med pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: This is emptiness endowed with all supreme aspects. The inseparability of these two is co-emergence.🔽One enters the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyi yid la 'jug / ces pa gdul bya'i don la'o ;
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid la 'jug / ces pa gdul bya'i don la'o ;
translated: This is for the sake of those to be tamed.

original: / sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs pa ni dus la bab pa la thugs bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: / sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs pa ni dus la bab pa la thugs bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: One is swifter than the mind of all sentient beings. This is never forgetting the right time.

original: sems can kun gyi dbang don shes pa ni dbang po rab 'bring tha ma la 'tsham par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi dbang don shes pa ni dbang po rab 'bring tha ma la 'tsham par ston pa'o //
translated: Knowing the faculties of all sentient beings is teaching in accordance with the faculties of the best, middling, and least.

original: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrog pa ni chos dang gdul bya'i sems zhi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrog pa ni chos dang gdul bya'i sems zhi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Stealing the minds of all sentient beings is the pacification of the minds of the Dharma and those to be tamed.

original: phung po lnga don ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga don ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the five aggregates is the divisions of form and so on.

original: de nyid shes pa ni ye shes rnam pa lngar ro //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa ni ye shes rnam pa lngar ro //
translated: Knowing that is the five kinds of pristine consciousness.

original: rnam dag phung po lnga chang ba ni gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad la sogs rigs lnga'i skur shar ba'o //
analyzed: rnam dag phung po lnga chang ba ni gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad la sogs rigs lnga'i skur shar ba'o //
translated: The purification of the five aggregates is the arising of the body of the five families, such as the aggregate of form as Vairocana.

original: da ni nges par 'byung ba la mdor bstan pa /
analyzed: da ni nges par 'byung ba la mdor bstan pa /
translated: Now, the result is explained.

original: nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas pa ni spyir theg pa gsum ka dang / sogs sngags kyi theg pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas pa ni spyir theg pa gsum ka dang / sogs sngags kyi theg pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Abiding in the end of all definite existences is the result of the three vehicles in general and the result of the mantra vehicle and so on.

original: des par 'byung ba kun la mkhas pa de'i don la'o //
analyzed: des par 'byung ba kun la mkhas pa de'i don la'o //
translated: Skilled in all definite existences is abiding in the meaning of that.

original: nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas pa ni mkhas pas don la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas pa ni mkhas pas don la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding on the path of all definite existences is abiding in the meaning of the skill.

original: nges par 'byung ba kun ston pa ni don de bzhin la rgya che bar ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba kun ston pa ni don de bzhin la rgya che bar ro //
translated: The teaching of definite release is the same in meaning but more extensive.

original: rgyas par bshad pa la rang rgyal ni /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa la rang rgyal ni /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //
translated: The pratyekabuddha extracts the root of existence with the twelve links.

original: zhes pa rang rgyal ba ni dur khrod kyi rus pa gang nas byung na shi ba las byung /🔽de sred pa las /
analyzed: zhes pa rang rgyal ba ni dur khrod kyi rus pa gang nas byung na shi ba las byung / de sred pa las /
translated: The pratyekabuddha knows that the bones in the charnel ground came from death,🔽that came from craving,

original: de len pa las /
analyzed: de len pa las /
translated: that came from grasping,

original: de srid pa las /
analyzed: de srid pa las /
translated: that came from existence,

original: de tshor ba las /
analyzed: de tshor ba las /
translated: that came from sensation,

original: de reg pa las /
analyzed: de reg pa las /
translated: that came from contact,

original: de skye mched drug las /
analyzed: de skye mched drug las /
translated: that came from the six sense bases,

original: de ming dang gzugs las /
analyzed: de ming dang gzugs las /
translated: that came from name and form,

original: de rnam par shes pa las /
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa las /
translated: that came from consciousness,

original: de 'du byed las /
analyzed: de 'du byed las /
translated: that came from formation,

original: de ma rig ba las byung bar shes pas /
analyzed: de ma rig ba las byung bar shes pas /
translated: and that came from ignorance.

original: ma rig pa 'gags nas rig pa rang la shar nas 'du byed 'gags nas rga shi'i bar du 'gags pas /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags nas rig pa rang la shar nas 'du byed 'gags nas rga shi'i bar du 'gags pas /
translated: When ignorance ceases, vidyā arises in oneself. When formation ceases, aging and death cease.

original: slob dpon med par rang sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon med par rang sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: Since one awakens without a master, one is a pratyekabuddha.

original: des na ngag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ni rten 'brel lugs las ldog pas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: des na ngag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ni rten 'brel lugs las ldog pas na dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the twelve aspects are reversed in the order of dependent origination, they are pure.

original: nyan thos ni bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ste /
analyzed: nyan thos ni bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ste /
translated: The Listeners have the aspects of the four truths: suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: de ltar 'phags pa rnams la bden par snang bas na bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa rnams la bden par snang bas na bden pa'o //
translated: Since they appear as truths to the noble ones, they are truths.

original: shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang //
translated: They possess the realization of the eight knowledges.

original: zhes pa chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pas phye bas bzhi la brgyad do //
analyzed: zhes pa chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pas phye bas bzhi la brgyad do //
translated: They are divided into eight by means of the knowledge of phenomena and subsequent knowledge.

original: bden don @224b rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
analyzed: bden don @224b rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
translated: They have the twelve aspects of the meaning of the truths.

original: zhes pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa gsum gyis phye bas bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa gsum gyis phye bas bcu gnyis so //
translated: They are divided into twelve by means of the three aspects of impermanence, suffering, and emptiness.🔽They know the sixteen aspects.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa /
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of phenomena with regard to suffering,

original: 'jig rten la chos shes pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten la chos shes pa /
translated: the knowledge of phenomena with regard to the world,

original: 'jig rten la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa /
translated: the acceptance of the subsequent knowledge with regard to the world,

original: 'jig rten la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: and the subsequent knowledge with regard to the world.

original: de bzhin bden pa gsum gsum po la yang brtsis pas mthong lam skad cig ma bcu drug ni nyan thos rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin bden pa gsum gsum po la yang brtsis pas mthong lam skad cig ma bcu drug ni nyan thos rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba'i lam mo //
translated: Likewise, if the three truths are counted in the same way, the path of seeing has sixteen moments.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byung ba'i lam ni /🔽rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byung ba'i lam ni / rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa //
translated: The path of definite emergence for bodhisattvas🔽is the ten grounds, which are traversed by means of the twenty aspects.

original: zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyad par bya ba'i chos pha rol tu phyin pa cu la spyad nas /
analyzed: zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyad par bya ba'i chos pha rol tu phyin pa cu la spyad nas /
translated: Having practiced the ten perfections, which are the qualities to be practiced by bodhisattvas,

original: bgrod par bya ba'i lam sa bcu bgrod pas na /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba'i lam sa bcu bgrod pas na /
translated: and having traversed the ten grounds, which are the paths to be traversed,

original: rnam pa nyi shus sa bcu'i byang chub sems so //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus sa bcu'i byang chub sems so //
translated: the bodhisattvas’ path of definite emergence is the ten grounds, which are traversed by means of the twenty aspects.

original: rnam par sangs rgyas kun rig mchog sbyar te rnam par ni snang ba sna tshogs so //
analyzed: rnam par sangs rgyas kun rig mchog sbyar te rnam par ni snang ba sna tshogs so //
translated: The supreme yoga of omniscience, the complete buddha,🔽is the twenty aspects.

original: kun rig ni phyi nang yul med de rang gi sems kyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: kun rig ni phyi nang yul med de rang gi sems kyi snang ba'o //
translated: “Omniscience” refers to the various appearances that are not external objects but one’s own mind.

original: des sangs rgyas kyi mchog grub pa'o //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas kyi mchog grub pa'o //
translated: By means of that, the supreme buddhahood is accomplished.

original: des chos sku thob nas gzhan don du sangs rgyas kun gyi sprul pa'i sku zhes pas sprul sku'o //
analyzed: des chos sku thob nas gzhan don du sangs rgyas kun gyi sprul pa'i sku zhes pas sprul sku'o //
translated: Having attained the dharmakāya, for the benefit of others, the nirmāṇakāya is the emanation of all buddhas.

original: de yang gcig tu ma nges te //
analyzed: de yang gcig tu ma nges te //
translated: Moreover, it is not definitely one,

original: bye ba dpag med 'gyed pa po //
analyzed: bye ba dpag med 'gyed pa po //
translated: but it is the one who sends out countless millions.

original: zhes pa kun khyab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa kun khyab pa'o //
translated: This is the all-pervading.

original: skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs //
analyzed: skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs //
translated: All moments are realized.

original: zhes pa skad cig ma skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa'i skad cig ma med par gcig tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa skad cig ma skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa'i skad cig ma med par gcig tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: This is the realization of the moment as one, without the moments of arising, abiding, and ceasing.

original: sems kyi skad cig don kun rig ni sems dang po ma skyes par du mi gnas tha ma mi 'gag pa'i don kun rig pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig don kun rig ni sems dang po ma skyes par du mi gnas tha ma mi 'gag pa'i don kun rig pa'o //
translated: The awareness of all objects in a moment of mind is the awareness of all objects without the mind abiding without the arising of the first moment and without the cessation of the last moment.

original: de ltar theg pa gsum thun mong la sbyar ba bstan nas gsang sngags bla na med pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa gsum thun mong la sbyar ba bstan nas gsang sngags bla na med pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the application to the three vehicles in common, the unsurpassed mantra is:

original: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //
translated: The root of existence is pulled out with the twelve branches.

original: zhes pa ni 'dir rten 'brel 'gag lugs ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir rten 'brel 'gag lugs ni /
translated: Here, the way of cessation of dependent origination is:

original: gang g-yo ba'i chags pa nyams pa de /
analyzed: gang g-yo ba'i chags pa nyams pa de /
translated: The impairment of the passion of movement

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes su gyur te /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes su gyur te /
translated: becomes the unchanging pristine consciousness.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i chags pa chen po la chags pas chags pa bral ba nyams pa /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i chags pa chen po la chags pas chags pa bral ba nyams pa /
translated: Since one is passionate about the great unchanging passion, the impairment of passionlessness

original: chags bral gyi ming ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: chags bral gyi ming ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: is called anger.

original: zhe sdang zad pas zhe sdang chen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhe sdang zad pas zhe sdang chen por 'gyur te /
translated: Hatred is exhausted by hatred, and so hatred becomes great hatred.

original: zhe sdang chen po sems brgyal ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: zhe sdang chen po sems brgyal ba'i ming ngo //
translated: Great hatred is the name for the fainting of the mind.

original: des gti mug nyams pas gti mug zad pa'i gti mug las kyang gti mug chen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: des gti mug nyams pas gti mug zad pa'i gti mug las kyang gti mug chen por 'gyur te /
translated: By that, delusion is impaired, and so delusion is exhausted, and delusion becomes great delusion.

original: des na chags pa chen po dang / zhe sdang chen po dang / gti mug chen pos chags pa dang // zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid can gyi ma rig pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: des na chags pa chen po dang / zhe sdang chen po dang / gti mug chen pos chags pa dang // zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid can gyi ma rig pa nyams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by great attachment, great hatred, and great delusion, attachment, hatred, and delusion are impaired, and ignorance with the nature of attachment, hatred, and delusion is impaired.

original: @225a * // ma rig pa nyams pas ma rig pa chen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: @225a * // ma rig pa nyams pas ma rig pa chen por 'gyur te /
translated: By the impairment of ignorance, great ignorance arises.

original: des ma rig pa 'gag / des 'du byed la sogs pa 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: des ma rig pa 'gag / des 'du byed la sogs pa 'gag pa'o //
translated: By that, ignorance ceases, and by that, formations and so on cease.

original: des na dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ba ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis 'gags nas sa bcu gnyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: des na dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ba ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis 'gags nas sa bcu gnyis thob pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who possesses the twelve pure aspects obtains the twelve stages after the cessation of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can nam bden pa bzhi ni sku bzhi'o //
analyzed: bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can nam bden pa bzhi ni sku bzhi'o //
translated: The four truths are the four bodies.

original: de'i rnam pa can ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bcas pa'i sku bzhi sad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bcas pa'i sku bzhi sad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhi'o //
translated: The one having its aspect is the four states of awakening, etc. of the four Bodies with adventitious stains.

original: shes pa brgyad po ni gnas skabs bzhi sku bzhir shes par byed do //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad po ni gnas skabs bzhi sku bzhir shes par byed do //
translated: The eight consciousnesses cause the four states to be known as the four Bodies.

original: dbang bzhi dang rnal 'byor bzhi'o //
analyzed: dbang bzhi dang rnal 'byor bzhi'o //
translated: The four initiations and the four yogas.

original: rtogs pa 'chang ba ni dbang bzhis ston pa /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'chang ba ni dbang bzhis ston pa /
translated: The bearer of realization is the teacher of the four initiations.

original: rnal 'byor bzhis nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bzhis nyams su len pa'o //
translated: The practitioner is the one who practices with the four yogas.

original: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
analyzed: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
translated: Endowed with the twelve aspects of the truth of the path.

original: zhes pa khyim bcu gnyis kyi rlung 'pho bas bcu gnyis 'gags nas /
analyzed: zhes pa khyim bcu gnyis kyi rlung 'pho bas bcu gnyis 'gags nas /
translated: The twelve aspects of the truth of the path are the twelve movements of the vāyu that cease.

original: gsung rdo rjes sems can rnams la chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rdo rjes sems can rnams la chos bstan pa'o //
translated: The vajra speech teaches the dharma to sentient beings.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces pa dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' bral dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dbye bas /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces pa dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' bral dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dbye bas /
translated: The one who knows the sixteen aspects of reality is the one who knows the sixteen aspects of reality through the divisions of joy, supreme joy, separation from joy, and connate joy.

original: sku'i dga' ba /
analyzed: sku'i dga' ba /
translated: The joy of the body,

original: gsung gi dga' ba /
analyzed: gsung gi dga' ba /
translated: the joy of speech,

original: thugs kyi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi dga' ba dang / de bzhin du sku'i chog dga' ba dang / gsung gi mchog dga' ba dang / thugs kyi mchog dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi mchog dga' ba'o //🔽de bzhin du sku'i dga' bral dang / gsung gi dga' bral dang / thugs kyi dga' bral dang / ye shes kyi dga' bral lo //
analyzed: thugs kyi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi dga' ba dang / de bzhin du sku'i chog dga' ba dang / gsung gi mchog dga' ba dang / thugs kyi mchog dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi mchog dga' ba'o // de bzhin du sku'i dga' bral dang / gsung gi dga' bral dang / thugs kyi dga' bral dang / ye shes kyi dga' bral lo //
translated: the joy of mind, the joy of pristine awareness, and similarly, the supreme joy of body, the supreme joy of speech, the supreme joy of mind, and the supreme joy of pristine awareness.🔽Likewise, there is the absence of joy of body, the absence of joy of speech, the absence of joy of mind, and the absence of joy of pristine awareness.

original: de bzhin du sku'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / gsung gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / thugs kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / gsung gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / thugs kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Likewise, there is the innate joy of body, the innate joy of speech, the innate joy of mind, and the innate joy of pristine awareness.

original: des na de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān has taught that the reality of the vajra of body, speech, and mind is the sixteen aspects of the four joys.

original: rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa ni rnam pa nyi shus mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gsung rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa ni rnam pa nyi shus mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gsung rdo rje ste /
translated: Enlightenment through the twenty aspects is the perfect enlightenment through the twenty aspects of the vajra of speech.

original: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
analyzed: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
translated: It has the twelve aspects of the truth of the path.

original: zhes pa sems can kun gyi skad kyis chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sems can kun gyi skad kyis chos ston pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Dharma in the language of all sentient beings.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba las mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba las mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste /
translated: The manifest perfect Buddhahood in the Net of Magical Manifestations is the Net of Magical Manifestations.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig pa mtha' yas pa'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig pa mtha' yas pa'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: That itself is the knowledge of the sixteen aspects, the Net of Magical Manifestations of infinite knowledge, the Emanation Body.

original: des na / rnam pa sangs rgyas kun rig mchog / ces pa rnam pa thams cad sgyu 'phrul dra bar go ba'o //
analyzed: des na / rnam pa sangs rgyas kun rig mchog / ces pa rnam pa thams cad sgyu 'phrul dra bar go ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the verse says, “The supreme knower of all aspects of all Buddhas.” The knowledge of all aspects is understood as the Net of Magical Manifestations.

original: des na / sangs rgyas kun gyi sprul pa'i sku //
analyzed: des na / sangs rgyas kun gyi sprul pa'i sku //
translated: Therefore, the verse says, “The emanation body of all Buddhas

original: bye ba dpag med 'gyed pa @225b po ;🔽zhes bya'o // skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs //
analyzed: bye ba dpag med 'gyed pa @225b po ; zhes bya'o // skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs //
translated: emanates countless millions.”

original: zhes pa phung po lnga ye shes lngar bya ba rdzogs pa'i skad cig la dga' bas na /
analyzed: zhes pa phung po lnga ye shes lngar bya ba rdzogs pa'i skad cig la dga' bas na /
translated: “Realizes all aspects” means that the five aggregates are the five gnoses.

original: rnam pa lnga pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni thugs rdo rje ste mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni thugs rdo rje ste mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The perfect Buddhahood in the five aspects is the mind vajra, the unchanging gnosis.

original: sems kyi skad cig don kun rig / ces pa skad cig ma gcig la sangs rgyas pa ni ye shes rdo rje ste don thams cad thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig don kun rig / ces pa skad cig ma gcig la sangs rgyas pa ni ye shes rdo rje ste don thams cad thob pa'o //
translated: In a single instant, one is aware of all objects.

original: de ltar gyas par bshad nas mjug bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar gyas par bshad nas mjug bsdu ba ni /
translated: Having explained in that way, the conclusion is:

original: theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul gyis //
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul gyis //
translated: By means of the various vehicles and methods,

original: zhe pa thun mong pa'i theg pa kun dang khyad par gsang sngags rdo rje'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: zhe pa thun mong pa'i theg pa kun dang khyad par gsang sngags rdo rje'i theg pa'o //
translated: the common vehicles and, in particular, the Secret Mantra Vajra Vehicle.

original: des na / 'gro ba'i don la rtogs pa po //
analyzed: des na / 'gro ba'i don la rtogs pa po //
translated: Therefore, the one who realizes the benefit of beings

original: zhes dgos pa blo'i bye brag gis so //🔽theg pa gsum gyis nges 'byung la //
analyzed: zhes dgos pa blo'i bye brag gis so // theg pa gsum gyis nges 'byung la //
translated: is the one who has the particular intellect.

original: zhes pa nyan thos rang rgyal byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nyan thos rang rgyal byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'o //
translated: The three vehicles are the vehicles of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: theg pa gcig gi 'bras bu gnas //
analyzed: theg pa gcig gi 'bras bu gnas //
translated: The result of the single vehicle is the state of nonseparation.

original: zhes pa dbyer mi phyed pa gsang sngags rdo rje'i theg par gsum po yang 'dus pa'o //🔽da ni dag bya gnyen po brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dbyer mi phyed pa gsang sngags rdo rje'i theg par gsum po yang 'dus pa'o // da ni dag bya gnyen po brjod par bya ste /
translated: The three are also included in the Secret Mantra Vajra Vehicle.

original: de nas dag bya la /
analyzed: de nas dag bya la /
translated: Now, the object of purification and the antidote will be explained.🔽Then, the object of purification is the all-basis.

original: nyon mongs khams rnams dag ba'i bdag / ces pa mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs bco brgyad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs khams rnams dag ba'i bdag / ces pa mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs bco brgyad do //
translated: refers to the eighteen elements, such as the eye element, the form element, and the eye consciousness element.

original: dag ba'i bdag ni ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: dag ba'i bdag ni ye shes kyis so //
translated: The self that is purified is by means of gnosis.

original: las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa //
analyzed: las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa //
translated: The one who has exhausted the elements of karma

original: zhes pa 'khor bar skye ba'i las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: zhes pa 'khor bar skye ba'i las kyi lam mo //
translated: refers to the paths of karma that give rise to rebirth in cyclic existence.

original: chu bo rgya mtsho kun las brgal //
analyzed: chu bo rgya mtsho kun las brgal //
translated: The one who has crossed over all the rivers and oceans

original: zhes pa skye rga na 'chi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa skye rga na 'chi la sogs pa'o //
translated: refers to birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on.

original: sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba ni rnal 'byor bzhi bsgoms pas 'khor ba las thar ba'o //🔽nyon mongs nye ba kun nyon mongs ni nyon mongs pa ni drug rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba ni rnal 'byor bzhi bsgoms pas 'khor ba las thar ba'o // nyon mongs nye ba kun nyon mongs ni nyon mongs pa ni drug rtsa ba'o //
translated: The one who has emerged from the wilderness of bondage refers to the one who is liberated from cyclic existence by means of cultivating the four yogas.🔽The one who has abandoned the afflictions and the secondary afflictions

original: nye ba kun nyon mongs ni nyi shu nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba kun nyon mongs ni nyi shu nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: refers to the six root afflictions and the twenty secondary afflictions.

original: bag chags ni sngar gyi rnying pa /
analyzed: bag chags ni sngar gyi rnying pa /
translated: The habitual tendencies are the old ones from the past.

original: bcas pa ni gsar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa ni gsar 'jog pa'o //
translated: The latent states are the new ones.

original: gtan spangs pa ni sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: gtan spangs pa ni sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: The one who has completely abandoned them is the Buddha.

original: de spang ba'i gnyen po ni snying rje chen po ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de spang ba'i gnyen po ni snying rje chen po ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is great compassion, which is without reference point.

original: shes rab ni ji lta ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni ji lta ba shes pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the knowledge of things as they are.

original: thabs ni gnyis so //
analyzed: thabs ni gnyis so //
translated: Skillful means is twofold.

original: don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa ni snying rje che dang bshes rab po //
analyzed: don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa ni snying rje che dang bshes rab po //
translated: The benefit of sentient beings without fail is great compassion and wisdom.

original: 'du shes kun ni bdag gzhan du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kun ni bdag gzhan du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: All perceptions are the grasping of self and other.

original: spangs pa ni de spangs pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa ni de spangs pa'o //
translated: Abandonment is the abandonment of that.

original: rnam shes ni tshog  drug go //
analyzed: rnam shes ni tshog  drug go //
translated: Consciousness is the six collections.

original: 'gag par byed pa ni mir tog pas so //
analyzed: 'gag par byed pa ni mir tog pas so //
translated: The one who causes cessation is the one who is not distracted.

original: sems can kun gyi yul dang ldan ni sems rang bzhin gyis dag ba'o //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yul dang ldan ni sems rang bzhin gyis dag ba'o //
translated: The one who possesses the object of all sentient beings is the naturally pure mind.

original: sems can kun gyi thugs rig pa ni sems @226a * //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi thugs rig pa ni sems @226a * //
translated: The one who knows the mind of all sentient beings is the naturally pure mind.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag pa las /🔽gnas pa dang sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs dang de'i'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag pa las / gnas pa dang sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs dang de'i'o //
translated: From the naturally pure mind,🔽the one who abides in the mind of all buddhas is that.

original: de sems can gyi yid la gnas pa yang de'o //
analyzed: de sems can gyi yid la gnas pa yang de'o //
translated: The one who abides in the mind of all sentient beings is that.🔽The one who engages in accordance with the mind

original: de dag sems dang mthun par 'jug / ces pa stong pa nyid du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sems dang mthun par 'jug / ces pa stong pa nyid du 'jug pa'o //
translated: is the one who engages in emptiness.

original: stong pa des sems can kun yid tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa des sems can kun yid tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who satisfies the minds of all sentient beings with that emptiness🔽is the one who is satisfied with emptiness.

original: sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
translated: The delight of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa zag med kyi bde ba la chags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa zag med kyi bde ba la chags pa'o //
translated: This is attachment to uncontaminated bliss.

original: grub pa mthar phyin ba ni mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: grub pa mthar phyin ba ni mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The perfected accomplishment is unchanging pristine consciousness.

original: des na de la 'khrul pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na de la 'khrul pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no delusion in that.

original: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa ni dngos por 'dzin pa dang dngos med du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa ni dngos por 'dzin pa dang dngos med du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Abandoning all errors is grasping things as existent and grasping things as nonexistent.

original: don gsum ni bdag gi dang gzhan gyi dang gnyis ka'i don to //
analyzed: don gsum ni bdag gi dang gzhan gyi dang gnyis ka'i don to //
translated: The three objects are one's own purpose, the purpose of others, and the purpose of both.

original: the tshom med pa'i blo ni don bya bar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i blo ni don bya bar bsam pa'o //
translated: The mind without doubt is the intention to perform the purpose.

original: kun don ni bdag dang gzhan no //
analyzed: kun don ni bdag dang gzhan no //
translated: The purpose of all is oneself and others.

original: yon tan gsum gyi bdag ni bdag don chos sku /
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi bdag ni bdag don chos sku /
translated: The nature of the three qualities is one's own purpose, the dharmakāya;

original: gzhan don sprul sku /
analyzed: gzhan don sprul sku /
translated: the purpose of others, the nirmāṇakāya;

original: byang chub sems dpa'i don du longs sku'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i don du longs sku'o //
translated: and the purpose of bodhisattvas, the saṃbhogakāya.

original: da ni ye shes kyi sku brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ye shes kyi sku brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the jñānakāya will be explained.

original: phung po lnga don ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga don ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the five aggregates is form and so on.

original: don ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: don ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The meaning is naturally pure.

original: dus gsum ni rgyu dang lam dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dus gsum ni rgyu dang lam dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: The three times are the cause, the path, and the result.

original: skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed ni rgyu'i skad cig dang ; lam dang 'bras bu'i skad cig gi dbye ba shes pa'o ;
analyzed: skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed ni rgyu'i skad cig dang ; lam dang 'bras bu'i skad cig gi dbye ba shes pa'o ;
translated: Distinguishing all the moments means knowing the distinctions of the moments of the cause, the path, and the result.

original: / skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas ni rgyu 'bras thams cad lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin du gcig pas /
analyzed: / skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas ni rgyu 'bras thams cad lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin du gcig pas /
translated: Perfect buddhahood in a single moment means that all causes and results are one in the nature of coemergence.

original: skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one is fully enlightened in a single instant.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang //
translated: Bearing the nature of all buddhas

original: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: refers to the jñanakaya.

original: lus med pa ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i lus med pa'o //
analyzed: lus med pa ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i lus med pa'o //
translated: Without a body means that there is no body composed of a collection of subtle particles.

original: lus de lus kyi mchog ni ye shes kyi lus so //
analyzed: lus de lus kyi mchog ni ye shes kyi lus so //
translated: That body is the supreme body, which is the jñanakaya.

original: lus kyi mtha' ni rtogs pa po ni mthar thug pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mtha' ni rtogs pa po ni mthar thug pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body’s end is the ultimate kaya.
